channel.title: Codes on Not today...
channel.description: Recent content in Codes on Not today...

item.description: HttpRouter HttpRouter is a lightweight high performance HTTP request router (also called multiplexer or just mux for short) for Go. In contrast to the default mux of Go’s net/http package, this router supports variables in the routing pattern and matches against the request method. It also scales better. The router is optimized for high performance and a small memory footprint. It scales well even with very long paths and a large number of routes.
